TextBody:
Hello Serhat,

Based on Netwrix support policy, tickets that have a fix included in released versions, I'm reaching out to you on current ticket that has a fix in 5.9.4.1. We'll get current ticket closed. Please do reopen the ticket in case related issues are observed.


Best regards,

Adrian Draghici |Technical Support Team Lead (EMEA/Asia/Aus)

Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.netwrix.com




This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 9/9/2024 2:07 PM
To: serhat.demir@booking.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #416619 - ERR_CONNECTION_RESET error while accessing websites [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Dndwo:ref ]

Hello Serhat,

I received a cumulative test build for the following issues:
00416233 - EPP writes every ~10 seconds a 0 byte .tpm file in temp directory
00416109 - ERR_connection_closed error while accessing websites
00416619 - ERR_CONNECTION_RESET error while accessing websites
00415365 - Browsing issue when DPI is enabled
00414948 - Client DPI Enables support for deprecated TLS versions and weak cipher suites


Here are the download links for the agents (Windows+Mac):
Windows: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp09092024/EPPClient_v6.2.3.0057.zip
Mac: https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp09092024/EPPMac3.0.3.0024.Notarized.tar

Please let me know if any of the issues can be still reproduced on your environment using the latest test build.

Thank you and Best regards,
Emil


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 8/29/2024 4:11 PM
To: serhat.demir@booking.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #416619 - ERR_CONNECTION_RESET error while accessing websites [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Dndwo:ref ]

Hello Serhat,

As Robert clarified during Monday's meeting ERR_CONNECTION_RESET/Closed errors showing up in case of certificate validation errors is expected behavior when Stealthy DPI is enabled as based on current design the connection is dropped when encountering a certificate validation error.
If users should be allowed to access websites presenting certificate errors "Bypass Invalid Peer Certificates" option under DPI Bypass would help here continue their work while Content Aware Report will specify the bypassed websites.
May we have the confirmation that as certificate for website kayak.pl was updated recently, the user is able to access both kayak.pl and kayak.nl?

Thank you,
Emil
--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Serhat Demir [serhat.demir@booking.com]
Sent: 8/19/2024 4:37 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #416619 - ERR_CONNECTION_RESET error while accessing websites

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000Dndwo:ref

Hi Emil,
Similar to the discussion in ticket: 416109

The recommended workaround ("Ignore Trust" option) will decrease the security of the user and trust chain in the TLS.

Is this issue considered as a bug that you are going to address in the lates releases?

Thanks,
-serhat
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #416619 - ERR_CONNECTION_RESET error while accessing websites    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Dndwo:ref ]
